content.text: Countries compete to become hosts for the Olympics. A host city is where the majority of the competitions take place. Countries increase the tourism rates and their economy benefits from it. We all have our favorite Olympics host city. Here are two examples, London and Beijing.
content.name: 4yuh

content.text: The London 2012 Olympics were very successful. Many spectators think they were more organized and more practical than other games. The host city won many medals too but UK business owners think they were not as important as other sports events. Chinese business owners, however, think that this is just as important as other events to benefit the economy.
content.name: aoe9

content.text: For China, the Olympic games improved more than the economy. Public transportation became more efficient than before and they had better infrastructure and technology. Public transportation became as good as public transportation in other countries. This was because Beijing was not as established as London in economic terms.
content.name: To9S

content.text: Beijing’s Olympics were more expensive than London’s. London spent about $42 million and China about $101 million. Because London is already an established economy, they did not have to spend a lot of money. China had the best pyrotechnics and the most spectacular opening show, London on the other hand, had the most unique show.
